Title: What is the Point of Taoism？ ｜ Tao Te Ching Chapter 59 Explained

Content.Knowledge Point: The importance of restraint and moderation in caring for others and serving heaven.
Content.Text: In caring for others and serving heaven, there is nothing like using restraint. Restraint begins with giving up one's own ideas.

Content.Knowledge Point: The role of virtue in developing restraint.
Content.Text: This depends on virtue gathered in the past. If there is a good store of virtue, then nothing is impossible.

Content.Knowledge Point: The relationship between virtue and the ability to give up desires.
Content.Text: If nothing is impossible, then there are no limits. If a man knows no limits, then he is fit to be a ruler.

Content.Knowledge Point: The Tao of long life and eternal vision.
Content.Text: The Tao of long life and eternal vision.

Content.Knowledge Point: The importance of done over perfect.
Content.Text: I'm just going to do it. I'm just going to give it a shot, and who knows, maybe I'll come back and revisit it in a couple years from now and I can do it more properly then.

Content.Knowledge Point: The summation of everything discussed in the Tao Te Ching up to this point.
Content.Text: This chapter, to me, is the summation of everything we've talked about up to this point surrounding the concept of virtue and following the Tao.

Content.Knowledge Point: The concept of restraint and moderation.
Content.Text: Restraint begins with, the ability or the determination to give up one's own ideas when necessary.

Content.Knowledge Point: The path to virtue and the role of intuition.
Content.Text: The path to virtue primarily involves being close enough to Tao to hear our intuition.

Content.Knowledge Point: The importance of following intuition and acting on it.
Content.Text: As we continue to follow them, they will direct us to act in ways that will bring us closer to Tao.

Content.Knowledge Point: The cycle of virtue and higher levels of intuition.
Content.Text: As we get closer to Tao, we will start to naturally change to become more like Tao.

Content.Knowledge Point: The ultimate goal of Daoism and spirituality.
Content.Text: This is the whole point of Daoism. This is the whole point of spirituality. This is the whole point of everything.
